result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan A. Reimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ethan A. Reimer

records.addlTxt: 09:06 AM Defendant Ethan A. Reimer in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Defendant Ethan A. Reimer in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation for 7 months and 25 days jail, 150 days credit.  Parties have reviewed revocation packet and have no additions or corrections.  Sentencing argument by State.  Chapter 950 compliance.  Sentencing argument by Def.'s Atty.  Def. makes statement to Court.  Court orders jail - 7 months and 25 days, huber, credit 150 days.  Any outstanding financial obligations converted to civil judgment.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.

11:40 AM Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights issue.  Hearing rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for November 27, 2019 at 09:00 am.

and Request for Court Hearing
Routed to JA
Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation

Defendant Ethan A. Reimer in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   16CM161 & 16CF250 called at 11:03 am.   16CM161 is the only case with restitution.  Statement by Atty Gebert.  Restitution amounts $392.00 and $4819.36.   Victim for $392.00 has not provided proof or documentation.  $4819.36  paid by State crime victim compensation.    S. S. from the victim compensation, duly sworn on oath, testifies.    Exhibit # 1- Itemized bill, marked by the State   Exhibit # 2 - Itemized bill, same, different format, marked by the State.  Court reviews exhibit 2.  State has no further witnesses.  K.R. duly sworn on oath, testifies.  No other witnesses.  State presents arguments for reimbursement of $4819.36.    Arguments presented by Atty Seifert.  Rebuttal argument by Atty Gebert.   Court will not order any restitution.  State will file motion for reconsideration.  Exhibits offered, received by court.

Defendant Ethan A. Reimer in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CM161 & 16CF250 called at 2:00 pm.  Plea agreement.  16CF250  CT 1 DRI, plea ct 2 , ct 3 DRI  plea ct 4.  16CM161 plea.   Probation 24 mo.  Cost DNA sample & surcharge, psychological evaluation, no contact victim,  counseling ,  Restitution $4819.36 and $392.00.   State has complied with victim rights.   Atty Seifert request hearing on restitution amount.   Victim impact statement provided to court.   Plea agreement reviewed with def.  Plea questionnaire form completed and reviewed with def.    16CF250  Ct 2 guilty plea  C4 guilty plea  16CM161 No contest plea    Court will grant state's motion and dismiss and read in Ct 1 & 3 in 16CF250.   Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Court finds def has freely & voluntarily entered into plea agreement, def understands charges, penalties and rights.   Factual basis.  Pleas accepted, found guilty 16CF250 Ct 2 & 4  16cm161 Ct 1.  State presents arguments for sentencing.   Sentencing arguments by Atty Seifert.  Statement by def.   Court will accept joint recommendations.  Same sentence on each count. Sentence withheld 2 yrs probation  cost, DNA sample and surcharge   Psychological  Evaluation unless already completed and signed release and follow through.  No contact with D. S.   Restitution held open subject to hearing.  No credit for time served.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 8, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court calls 16CF250 & 16CM161 @ 2:11 pm.  Defendant Ethan A. Reimer in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Seifert is request preliminary hearing.  State revokes offer.  Deputy Thomas Connelly, Langlade County Sheriff Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies. Atty Seifert gives argument. State gives argument.  Court reviews statue 940.24(4). Court gives ruling on statute and finds probable cause and binds over for filing an information. Information sent electronically.  Atty Seifert will proceed.  Atty Seifert enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea.  Bond Continues. 16CM161 will continue to follow.  Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ethan A. Reimer in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Special appearance.  Complaint received and reviewed.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will receive not guilty plea.  Bond recommendations.  Court sets bond  Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
